channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump announces newest nominations to lead DOJ, regulate US railroads
item.description: President-elect Trump announced Saturday Aaron Reitz, Chad Mizelle and David Fink will serve in various Department of Justice and Department of Transp...

item.title: Don’t Punish People for Crimes They Haven’t Committed Yet
item.description: It sounds sci-fi, but one Florida county actually tried Minority Report –style policing. The experiment never should have gotten off the ground.

item.title: New J6 Transcript Contradicts Hutchinson’s Claims Trump Went Grand Theft Auto
item.description: Lawmakers voted to release testimony previously concealed for contradicting a hyperbolic narrative from the J6 Committee's star witness.

item.title: ABC News’ Calculated Surrender to Trump on Stephanopoulos’s Sleaze
item.description: Technically, it’s unlikely they committed defamation, but they deserve the rebukes they’re getting.

item.title: Millions Of Americans Will Do Anything For Their Kids’ Sports, Including Cutting Church
item.description: Travel sports has grown into a $39 billion dollar industry while churches are seeing a decrease in members and Sunday worshippers.

item.title: Trump taps 'Apprentice' producer, Mark Burnett, as special envoy to the United Kingdom

item.title: Lee Edwards, 1932-2024
item.description: Remembering the conservative movement’s preeminent chronicler.

item.title: Senate clears government funding extension, averting shutdown with no time to spare
item.description: The Senate early Saturday passed legislation to extend government funding through March 14, barely averting a shutdown with a vote coming just after t...

item.title: Trump sues to stop Biden's sale of border wall gear
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump is suing to halt the Biden administration's sale of border wall parts, arguing that the act is "possibly criminal."

item.title: Ivy League Faculties Fail The ‘Sodom And Gomorrah’ Test Of Having 10 Righteous Inhabitants
item.description: New universities will arise, and others that can meet the Sodom and Gomorrah test will reform themselves to offer an intellectually diverse and ideolo...

item.title: Lara Trump removes herself from consideration for Marco Rubio’s US Senate seat
item.description: Lara Trump, former RNC co-chair and President-elect Trump's daughter-in-law, said Saturday she is withdrawing from consideration to replace Marco Rubi...

item.title: Lawmakers react to stopgap funding and averting government shutdown

item.title: How Trump Can Make The Auto Industry Great Again
item.description: Some of the world’s largest automakers may not survive our government-created debacle, but collapse of the industry can still be stopped.

item.title: Trump nominates TV producer, creator of 'The Apprentice,' to serve in new administration
item.description: President-elect Trump has tapped Mark Burnett, a TV producer and the creator of "The Apprentice," to serve in a diplomatic role in the United Kingdom.

item.description: In March the Republican-led House passed H.R. 3391, which would continue funding research of pediatric diseases like childhood cancer. The legislation...

item.title: Rockin’ around the congressional Christmas tree
item.description: Although the House of Representatives rejected the 1,547-page interim spending bill, lawmakers reached an agreement Friday to avoid a government shutd...

item.title: The Rothschilds’ Waddesdon Manor: Not Your Typical English Country House
item.description: A French château look, porcelain, silk, and paintings galore, plus an automaton the size of a baby elephant.

item.title: Trump’s Difficult Choice in Syria
item.description: There are ‘good guys’ in Syria — and the U.S. should continue to support them.
